column4: is it possible that my graphics are being driven from another file other than my xorg.conf file?
is it possible that my graphics are being driven from another file other than my xorg.conf file?
well my xorg file is completely blank
and here I am in GDE
you can do a X -config or Xorg -config  to generate one then move it to /etc/X11/ dir i forget which command it is
what do you want to do?
ok install xp to some freespace but then youll need to reinstall grub as xp will hose the mbr
I can't edit the grub.conf file so I don't have to reinstll GRUB?
did you install windows or ubuntu first?
I have Ubuntu Gutsy using my whole HDD

like juano__ said grub actually is installed to the first 512bytes of the hd now it loads stuff from the boot partition but the mbr is actually what needs to be fixed after you install windows as windows will install its own mbr
so how do I recover the mbr that I need?
well idealy you install windows first then let ubuntu install last and it handles everything but if you install xp last then you need to follow that fixmbr link that ubotu mentioned
ok I went to those links... but I am not finding anything like fixmbr
ignore that just do the grub install thing in the steps on that page
should I be tuning into the section called: recovering GRUB automatically ?
